titleStmt.title: Worley More et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9773

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his Excellency Beriah Magoffin Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

we the undersigned petitioners would most respectfully ask of your Excellency to remit a fine against Andrew Ingram, fwho was fined (befeore Esquire Thomas Spencer a Justice of the peace of Bath County) thirty dollars and fifteen days imprisonment for the offense of having committed a breach of the peace in August 1860. We would state that the said Andrew Ingram is a good law abiding citizen, and a poor man with a large family, and it would be an act of Executive clemency to remit the aforsaid fine=all of which is most respectfully submitted to your Excellency=
